results.content: Very good course! t would be a good idea to have a basic understanding of python prior to this course to understand what you're doing instead of feeling like you're just copying and pasting code. But overall a very good course!

results.content: Great Coverage!! Charlie has the knowledge on web scraping..  Explains it beautifully. The only down side is if you are using windows PC, the installations are not explained. However, he does cover them for people haveing queries thru the discussions forum. The course goes little too fast.. But 5 stars.. 5 stars all the way..

results.content: I paid $19 for this course.  In one loooooong night, watching this course, paired with some additional digging around online and some other Udemy courses, I was able to scrape a few websites and connect to a MySQL database.  The course is a bit fast and definitely leaves you struggling quite often, especially if you're using Windows, but overall I gained a few new very valuable skills in a short amount of time for a small price.
results.content_html: I paid $19 for this course. The course is a bit fast and definitely leaves you struggling quite often, especially if you're using Windows, but overall I gained a few new very valuable skills in a short amount of time for a small price.

results.content: I bought this class for exposure to scraping with python. It's mostly been using import.io. There is little actual learning around breaking down what the code means. It is mostly just copy what the instructor writes as he dictates. Another frustration is that the instructor uses the words "this" and "that" alot making it difficult to follow unless you are actively watching the video, which slows down comprehension.

response.content: Rob, it would be helpful if you could post questions before leaving a rating. That way I can fix portions of the course that are confusing. Are there particular areas that are confusing?

results.content: High quality, very concise, best money I ever spent on a web scraping course.  There are countless books, online courses, and other miscellaneous avenues who claim to teach you web scraping. However, this course, in my opinion, is the most direct way to learn for someone with a non-technical/non-coding background.
